result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn Alexander Foreman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deshawn Alexander Foreman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deshawn Alexander Foreman was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete vocational training; maintain full-time employment.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
